Sri Mulyani Jadi Guru Sehari, Siswa SD Berebut Jawab Pertanyaan
04 Nov 2019, 03:10 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati menjadi guru sekolah dasar (SD) Kenari I, Kwitang, Jakarta Selatan selama satu hari, Senin, 4 November 2019. Berdasarkan pantauan Tempo, Sri Mulyani mengisi materi untuk kelas VI A SD Kenari I.
Adapun Sri Mulyani datang ke sekolah sekitar pukul 09.00 WIB. Mengenakan kemeja putih dan celana panjang berwarna hitam, dia langsung disambut oleh para guru dan masuk ke ruang tamu dinas sekolah.
Setelah berbincang dengan para guru, bendahara negara itu kemudian langsung masuk ke kelas. Setelah berkenalan dengan murid-murid kelas VI A, dia memulai dengan pembahasan soal pengenalan negara Indonesia.
"Ada yang tahu negara kita ini apa namanya? Tetangganya mana saja?" kata Sri Mulyani bertanya di depan kelas, Senin 4 November 2019.
Selain mengisi materi soal negara Indonesia dan keberagaman, dia juga memberikan materi mengenai pengelolaan keuangan negara. Dia melemparkan pertanyaan mengenai bagaimana negara mendapat uang.
"Kalau Menteri Keuangan tugasnya kelola keuangan negara, uangnya kira-kira dari mana ya?" tanya dia.
Sontak anak-anak pun mengacungkan jari telunjuk untuk menjawab. Bahkan beberapa anak berebut untuk bisa menjawab dengan mengatakan: "Saya, saya."
Beberapa anak kemudian menjawab bahwa negara mendapat uang dari berbagai sumber. Ada yang menjawab berasal dari pajak dan cukai, serta jual beli.
Kedatangan Sri Mulyani untuk menjadi guru selama sehari merupakan bagian dari rangkaian acara "Peringatan Hari Oeang 2019." Dalam acara ini, Kementerian Keuangan mengajak para pegawainya untuk menjadi relawan mengajar bagi anak-anak sekolah.
Adapun kegiatan relawan dari Aparatur Sipil Negara (ASN) Kementerian Keuangan ini digelar secara serentak di Indonesia. Acara ini digelar di 27 provinsi dengan melibatkan 3.700 relawan pegawai Kementerian Keuangan. Acara ini diklaim tak menggunakan dana APBN namun menggunakan dana pihak yang menjadi relawan.

Sri Mulyani Becomes a Day Teacher, Elementary Students Fight for Questions
04 Nov 2019, 03:10 by Dias Prasongko, Kodrat Setiawan
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati became a Kenari I elementary school teacher, Kwitang, South Jakarta for one day, Monday, November 4, 2019. Based on Tempo's observations, Sri Mulyani filled in material for Class VI A SD Kenari I .
Sri Mulyani came to school around 09.00 WIB. Wearing a white shirt and black trousers, he was immediately welcomed by the teachers and entered the school office's living room.
After talking with the teachers, the country's treasurer then went straight into the classroom. After getting acquainted with students of class VI A, he began with a discussion about the introduction of the Indonesian state.
"Does anyone know what our country is called? Where are the neighbors?" Sri Mulyani said in front of the class, Monday, November 4, 2019.
In addition to filling in material on the matter of the Indonesian state and diversity, he also provided material on managing state finances. He threw a question about how the country gets money.
"If the Minister of Finance is responsible for managing state finances, where will the money come from?" he asked.
Suddenly the children raised their index fingers to answer. Some children even scramble to answer by saying: "I, me."
Some children then answer that the state gets money from various sources. Some answered that it came from taxes and excise, as well as buying and selling.
Sri Mulyani's arrival to become a teacher for a day was part of a series of events "Commemoration of 2019 Oeang Day." In this event, the Ministry of Finance invites its employees to become teaching volunteers for school children.
The volunteer activities of the Ministry of Finance's State Civil Apparatus (ASN) were held simultaneously in Indonesia. The event was held in 27 provinces involving 3,700 volunteers from the Ministry of Finance. This event is claimed not to use state budget funds but to use funds from volunteers.
